alert.note: Alert for Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 9:53PM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Sand Hill River at Climax affecting Polk County. .Water levels will briefly exit flood stage Saturday night into Sunday morning before jumping back into Minor Flood Stage by Sunday afternoon. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sand Hill River at Climax. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 20.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM CDT Friday was 21.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Sunday morning and continue rising to a crest of 24.5 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
